comments.author: Tiffani
comments.content:
Just make sure to not touch the chilies! I made that mistake once a few years ago and my fingers burned for 3 days! My eyes burned from inadvertently moving my head over the steam too.  So wish i would have known they were hot peppers and not sweet peppers. Lol

I can't get lemon grass where i live now. Would it still taste ok without? I was thinking of using fresh basil instead.

comments.author: ivy manning
comments.content: Yum, Michael! Mr. Tofu loves dry curries like this, and it's so nice and adaptable...who would have thunk of delicata? I like kambocha squash in curry, but never tried little delicata. They're actual much more practical since it's just the two of us. Thanks for idea!

comments.author: hollynoel001h\
comments.content: i'm not much on tofu but the squash and red curry paste sound awesome!!

comments.author: Hillary
comments.content: Great vegetarian recipe! You should submit this recipe to Recipe4Living.com! :)

comments.author: Jen
comments.content: This recipe was ridiculously delicious--and I was proud to have all the ingredients on hand or growing. AND you give another recipe to use with my leftover paste (although I'd gladly just make it again. The little delicata moons, which I'd never had before, were luscious!) Thanks so much for your blog!

comments.author: Valerie
comments.content: I make it with butternut squash (one small rather than 2 good-sized), and that works very well.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Sounds great! Thanks for taking the time to comment.

comments.author: Jana
comments.content: This sounds awesome. My only gripe- New Mexico chile is spelled with an e at the end, not an i, just like the country. Thanks for all your recipes and tips!

comments.author: Jennifer
comments.content: This was excellent!  I cheated and used a jarred sauce, but the combination of the delicata, tofu and broccoli was great.

comments.author: Amy
comments.content: Just made this, and, as sometimes happens, I was unable to get all the right ingredients. No delicata available so I used one acorn squash and one small butternut; I was only able to get arbol chiles, so I used six, but I discarded the seeds of four of them since they are hotter, and we could still discern all the flavors in the curry. We all loved it. When delicata turns up in the store I will definitely make it again.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Sounds great! The other squash should work just fine, they just have to get peeled and may need a longer cooking time.

comments.author: Serenity
comments.content: I missed the past where you add the soaked chilies to the ingredients in the blender. Do you drain the chilies first or do you add the soaking liquid as well? Thanks.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Drain them mostly, blend, then add back liquid as needed.
